conversation.content: Um, so I'm trying to figure out... hmm, which payroll system I'm supposed to, uh, contact about my missing wages?
Okay so. Let me just. Pull up your info here. Um, can I get your employee ID? Should start with SUB or maybe TMP.
I think it's... wait, let me see here... SUB-4782? Or maybe that's my, um, district badge number?
Right right. So SUB-4782. Hmm, that's actually. Let me check. Are you with, uh, the main district payroll or the, um, third-party system? SmartSub maybe? Or um, Frontline?
That's what I'm trying to figure out! The last person said SmartSub but, uh, they couldn't find me either.
Okay okay. So um, let's back up here. When you first. Got hired. Did they give you, uh, any paperwork with like a system code? Would be something like FSS-2024 or DPS-something?
Um, I mean, I got so many papers... probably? I don't, uh, I don't really know what to look for.
No no that's. That's fine. Um, so here's what I'm seeing. Your ID SUB-4782 is showing in, uh, two systems actually? Which is. Hmm. Not supposed to happen.
Two systems? So maybe that's why I haven't been, um, paid in like... it's been three weeks now?
Three weeks? Oh. Oh that's. Um, okay so let me escalate. Your case number is gonna be PAY-88291-MK. And uh, this is definitely. Not right.
I mean, I've got bills and, um, my daughter needs her medication next week, so I kind of need this sorted...
Absolutely. I get it. So um, what I'm doing now. I'm flagging this as urgent. Reference code URG-1127-P. And uh, let me see which system actually. Has your hours logged.
Um, okay so... hmm, what if neither one has them? Because I've been, uh, I've been working, definitely.
Right so. The main district system. Shows you active but. No hours. And SmartSub has um, has hours logged but. Your status is. Pending? Since October apparently.
October?! But I started in, um, in November... that doesn't even... how does that make sense?
Yeah that's. Um. That's weird. Let me. Hmm. Okay so your onboarding date in file ONB-9847-XX says November fifteenth. But SmartSub thinks you started October second?
I mean, maybe someone else has my, uh, my ID or something? I don't know, I'm just... this is really frustrating.
No I totally. I get it. So um, here's what we're gonna do. I'm merging both records. Under case MRG-4455-TN. And uh, routing this directly to. Payroll supervisor.
Um, okay but like... is this actually going to fix it? Or am I gonna have to, uh, call back again next week?

So I'm putting a. Seven-two hour flag. On this. Which means um, someone has to respond by Thursday. Code PRI-7209. And I'm also. Gonna email you directly. With the supervisor's extension. Just in case.

scenario: substitute teacher, confused about which payroll system she should contact about missing wages
